intro.para: For Acts relating to particular Places or Persons, see Titles Local acts, Personal acts; and for Acts relating to any Matters in which the King is a Party, see Title The King.

tr.td: For preventing of Abatements of Writs of Error upon Judgements in the Exchequer.

The not coming of the Lord Chancellor or Lord Treasurer not to abate Writs of Error if either of the Chief Justices are in the Exchequer Chamber.
In the Title of 21 E. III. St. 1. c. 13. it is said, "The Lord Chancellor and" Lord Treasurer;" and in the Body it is said, "Chancellor and Treasurer," without the Word or Epithet "Lord". See 4 Inst. p. 105.
But no Judgment given unless Lord Chancellor and Treasurer be present.
For proceeding to Judgment on Writs of Error brought in the Exchequer.
Judgments may be given in Writs of Error in Presence of the Lord Keeper, notwith standing the Vacancy of the Lord Treasurer.
Monies, &c. vested in His Majesty not pardoned by the Act of Oblivion.

entry.head: Act of Uniformity See The Church Declaration of act of uniformity.

tr.td: Stat. 12 Car. II. cc. 14. 29. 33. confirmed and declared to have the full Force of Acts of Parliament.
The Acts confirmed by this Act are expired except 12 Car. II. c. 14.

entry.head: Administrator de bonis non suing Scire Facias See Delays in Suits of Law.

tr.td: For restoring Advowsons, Rectories, Impropriate Glebe Lands, and Tythes, to the King's Subjects, and making void certain Charges imposed for Delinquency by the late usurped Powers.
Grants, &c. heretofore compelled, void in Law.
Proviso for Rights accured (Exception) before May 19, 1662.
Tenants of such Advowsons, &c. to pay their Rents to Persons entitled before such Grants, &c.
Purchasers to pay, and former Owners to hold the said Rents, with Remedies by Distress, &c.
For taking of Affidavits in the Country to be made use of in the Courts of King's Bench, Common Pleas, and Exchequer.
Chief Justices and Lord Chief Baron may empower Persons, by Commission, to take Affidavits.
Judges of Assize, in their Circuits, may take Affidavits concerning Matters depending in the King's Bench, Common Pleas, and Exchequer.
Penalty on forswearing, the same as if sworn in open Court.

Fee, besides the King's Duty.
The Powers of this Act extended to the Isle of Man, 6 G. III. c. 50. §2.

entry.head: St. Alban's, Borough of See Post Office. Wine.

tr.td: For the further Restraint of tippling in Inns, Alehouses, and other Victualling Houses.
Penalties of Stat. 1 Jac. I. c. 9. extended to Innkeepers permitting tippling by Persons not Inhabitants
Tavern-keepers and Victuallers declared within the Act.
For the better suppressing of unlicensed Alehouse-keepers.
Proof of Offence by View or Confession or Oath of Two Witnesses.
If not paid within Three Days after Distress appraised and sold.
Offender not having Goods, or not paying Penalty within Six Days after Conviction—Punishment.
Not to be twice punished for the same Offence.

Proviso for Fairs.
Licensing Alehouses in England regulated, 26 G. II. c. 31.
For obtaining of Licenses of Alienation, and in the Pleading of Alienations with License, or of Pardons of Alienations without License, in the Court of Exchequer and elsewhere.
License, or of Alienation to be general.
Fee to Officer for drawing, &c. Alienations with License, and Pardon of Alienation without License.
Penalty on Officer taking greater or other Fee.
For taking off Aliens' Duty upon Commodities of the Growth, Product, and Manufacture of the Nation.

Part of Stat. Hen. VII. c. 14.–12 Car. II. c. 4. and of other Acts concerning Customs upon Native Commodities, except Coals, and of the Book of Rates mentioned in Stat. 12 Car. II. c. 4. repealed.
The Rules, &c. annexed to the Book of Rates repealed, 27 G. III. c. 13. §31.

Denizens and Aliens to pay no more on Exportation of Native Commodities than natural-born Subjects, except for Coals.
All Duties on Exportation of Woollen Goods granted by this Act repealed, 11 & 12 W. III. c. 20. § 1.

Nor for Fish of English catching and exported in English Shipping.
This Act continued for Four Years, 2 W. & M. c. 4. §2.
For the speedy disbanding the Army, &c. of England.
For enabling disbanded Soldiers to exercise Trades.
To prevent Arrests of Judgments and superseding Executions.
In Verdicts in Courts at Westminster, of Counties Palatine, and Wales, Judgment not stayed, &c. for Want of Form, &c.
Nor Judgment after Verdict, &c. reversed for Matters herein mentioned.
In what Actions Execution not stayed by Writ of Error without Recognizance under Stat. 3 Jac. I. c. 8.
What Security to be given by Plaintiff in Dower, &c.
Writ of Inquiry of Mesne Profits—Damages and Costs.
Proviso for Writs of Error in certain Actions.
Stat. 16 & 17 Car. II. c. 8. made perpetual.

entry.head: Assize of Darrein Presentment See Michaelmas Term.

tr.td:
For the reversing the Earl of Strafford his Attainder.
See King Charles I.

entry.head: Attaint on Jury for verdict See Customs, Revenue of.

tr.td: For confirming and perpetuating Augmentations made by Ecclesiastical Persons to small Vicarages and Curacies
Augmentations payable since 1st June 12 Car. II. and hereafter, to continue during the Estate upon which they are reserved, and afterwards.
Augmentations exceeding one Moiety of clear yearly Value, not confirmed.
Augmentation Leases to be entered by Registers of Archbishop, &c.
Such Entry how to be attested.
To be as a Record and Evidence.
Agreements for Augmentations to be entered likewise.
Such Augmentation so entered to continue for the Benefit of the Vicar, &c. as if reserved by the Lease.
Augmentations to be construed as charitable Uses.
New Leases, without express Continuation of the Augmentation, void.
Proviso for Lease of the Parsonage of Stourton in Nottinghamshire.

The like for St. Evall in Cornwall.
See Adbowsons.
For speedy Proceedings upon Distresses and Avowries for Rents.
Remedy upon a Nonsuit in Replevin before Issue—Writ of Inquiry of Damages. —On Notice to Plaintiff, Sheriff to execute Writ—Judgment for Defendant—Execution.
Remedy upon a Nonsuit after Issue—Judgment for Avowant—Execution.
Where Goods not of sufficient Value, Distress from time to time for Residue.
Stat. 17 Car. II. c. 7. extended to the Courts of Great Sessions for Wales, the Court of Great Sessions and Assizes for Chester, and the Courts of Common Pleas for Durham and Lancaster.
